dialogues.text: You're not getting anywhere, are you? Chuck swallows a smart ass reply, and glances at the Chie

dialogues.text: That's why you're here. To save our poor souls. You got any ideas?

dialogues.text: A few. <BEAT> We're dealing with a very organized killer, someone who plans. These killings aren't random, spur of the moment things. He only kills who he wants to kill. Low risk victims in low risk areas, no witnesses--everything planned out very well. Out of the corner of his eye, Chuck sees the Chief leave. turns his attention back to Ken.

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: His behavior reflects his personality, and his behavior is very controlled, well orchestrated. His M.O. exists nowhere else. Now, I thought... Chuck holds up his hand for Ken to stop talking.

dialogues.text: So, you can have all the bullshit theories you want, and write all the stupid reports, but stay the fuck out of my way when it gets dirty. He stares straight at Ken, who half expected it.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: Yeah. I got it.

Finally, Chuck comes forward, to put a stop to thi As soon as he dislodges from the shadows, the figure atta A fight ensues, and both men are very skilled fighters. A they fight, Chuck pulls out a small flashlight, and tries light it to illuminate the other. The other man pulls out own flashlight. Finally, the flashlights come on together, and the fighte see each other--it's Ken!

dialogues.text: I'm picking up impressions...

dialogues.text: There was no sign of forced entry, and the explosion was pretty primitive-- gasoline and a stick of dynamite. I didn't see a timer, so he had to be waiting for Detective Burke...

dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.text: I found it, skulking. He was waiting for Burke here to come running, maybe he's tied into our GPS system so he can track our vehicles, and blew the place up just before he went inside.

dialogues.text: To cover his tracks?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: To send a message--the killings are getting closer together, and he's getting better. It's almost as if he's learning. And, he's getting more confident, so now he's sending us the computer notes, taunting us...This guy is so out there with technology, and I'm lost. I know a computer hacker from a case a couple of years ago. I want to go see him, get some advice on the computer end of things.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCHINS
dialogues.text: Well, don't stand around here.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK

dialogues.text: Uncle Ken, I've been waiting... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: What are you doing still here? After the interview, I told you go home. We'll call you if we need anything more.

dialogues.text: I want to be involved.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: You have to stay out of it.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Sorry, Kelly. Go home, and I'll call you when I know something. (softens) Really, Kelly. Go home. Ken and Chuck walk away.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Man, she's got guts, asking to work with us. Chuck is impressed with Kelly, and looks over his shoulde her.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: You tag along with me, you play by my rules. (no answer from Ken) So, you and Kelly have a thing going?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: With Kelly? She's like my own daughter! <BEAT> Oh, I get it. I don't think you're her type. Chuck looks at him strangely for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Oh, really? Why? Because I'm black?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: No, because you're an asshole. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: The CAMERA does a SLOW PAN across the room. It is very di lit, with the only real light source coming from four or computer monitors at one end. The place is a pit, filled with dirty clothes, trash, boo notes, papers and everything else you can think of. Lots Star Trek, Deep Space Nine, Alien stuff adorns the walls, and furniture. At one of the black, oversize monitors sits JUSTICE, an overweight man with thick glasses. He is holding a bottle front of himself, relieving himself. He then types on his ergonomic keyboard, and talking to himself while he does. He SLIDES his chair over to another computer, slides a CD into the machine, and starts another program.

dialogues.text: I bet you're hot, aren't you?

dialogues.text: Shall I take off my top? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: olden rev. 10/17/97)

dialogues.text: olden rev. 10/17/97) 34 INSERT ON SCREEN--Justice clicks his mouse on the sexy gi image, and the top disappears. Justice laughs, and a KNOC heard 0.S.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Damn! Don't cool off! I'll be right back. Justice gets up and goes to the door.

dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.text: Police. I need to ask you some questions.

dialogues.text: What kind of questions?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (0.S.)

dialogues.speaker: JUSTICE
dialogues.text: Just a minute. He looks frantically around the room, trying to figure ou what to do. He looks over at the window, its shades drawn and makes up his mind.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Be right there. Justice grabs his bag off the floor and heads for the win He throws open the shades and slides the window back, the starts to climb out. Before he gets too far, however, Ken face comes INTO FRAME, next to Justice.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Detective O'Hara here, Justice. Remember me? You going somewhere? Justice swallows hard and then edges back through the win Ken follows him back in and then opens the door for Chuck

dialogues.text: olden rev. 10/17/97) 35

dialogues.text: For what? I didn't do nothing!

dialogues.text: Pack some petroleum jelly, computer boy. You're gonna need it! Chuck grabs him by the lapels and PROPELS him across the SLAMMING him into the wall.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don't play dumb! You did it!

dialogues.text: You mean the bank computer? I didn't do anything...

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Justice. Detective Burke and I don't necessarily see eye to eye. <BEAT> Burke, I need his help with my investigation.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTICE
dialogues.text: I'll help you! I'1l help you!

dialogues.text: Shut the hell up! No way this scumbag is getting out of this!

dialogues.text: C'mon, he said he'd help. You'll help, right?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTICE
dialogues.text: Yeah! Yeah! Whatever you need! Ken smiles at Chuck, and they make eye contact--they work together.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Let's sit down. They sit down, and Ken notices the virtual vixen on the c screen. He touches the keyboard and she says

dialogues.text: olden rev. 10/17/97) 36

dialogues.text: Cool! Hey, man, what button did you push?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Can you trace e-mail, graphics files and other messages? These were sent to the station.

dialogues.text: Sure. It's not hard. Ken takes a couple of diskettes out of his pocket and han them to Justice. Chuck, meanwhile, is looking at the desk and the apartmen general. There is a big bottle, like a Thermos, under the table. He picks it up, hefting it.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTICE
dialogues.text: Later, baby. Wait for me. He pulls up the first file and scans it quickly.

dialogues.speaker: JUSTICE, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: (holding up the bottle) What's this for?

dialogues.speaker: JUSTICE
dialogues.text: That's for my all nighters, so I don't have to leave my computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken, Chuck and Kelly walk up to the front of the prison a inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken, Chuck and Kelly are walking along the street. Someon comes up to them, map in hand, and asks for directions. T give him the directions, and the man thanks them, then wa away. When he gets a little ways away, he turns around an looks back. It is the Killer, smiling! We FREEZE FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken and Chuck together, sitting at a table in a restauran They are just relaxing, fooling around. Chuck is doing a trick, and Ken is laughing as Chuck makes the water disap in a glass right in front of his eyes. They haven't compl become great friends, but they are getting there.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: He didn't spring from nowhere. This guy had to have trained. He's too good!

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: No one teaches killing people.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: He's testing different killing methods. We believe the arts effectiveness, but he's actually trying it out. He's got a list of victims...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: And we just made the top forty.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: I've got the feeling that he's almost done. I just wish we knew the sequence. Who was next. He pauses for a BEAT, looking into his glass of beer. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: olden rev. 10/17/97)

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Why'd you quit, Ken? Ken looks at him for a long moment, trying to measure why is asking. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: olden rev. 10/17/97) 57 Finally, he sighs and resigns himself to telling the stor maybe for the very first time.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: I was working serials, like you. I tracked the bastard, got inside his head, he had killed 10 by then, and I took him down. But I had seen too much, done too much. I just never wanted to experience that kind of evil again. Didn't want it in my life...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: He messed you up pretty good, right?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Almost killed me. Killed my marriage too. I'm trying to salvage it, but...you saw for yourself... Chuck nods, remembering the scene at Ken's house.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: I was married, long time ago. When I was in the academy. It ended badly, and I blamed it on the job, but that wasn't it. I just didn't try hard enough.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Too bad.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: I don't know much about you, Ken, but you don't seem like the kind of guy to give up. Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Then, you shouldn't give up on your marriage, man. To this day, my only regret is that I didn't save my marriage, when I could have. All I had to do was call her... They sit in silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All you have to do is call her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: olden rev. 10/17/97) 58

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: How is this parable about you suddenly about me?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: The moral of the story is just give her a call, see if you can save it. You got the chance. Take it.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Maybe I will.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: You've got motive, and you've got opportunity. You're guilty. He points to a line of phones at the back of the bar. Ken looks at the phones, then back at Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: You know nothing about me.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Don't want to know any more. Believe me. Chuck produces a coin from Ken's ear.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell you what. Here's an ordinary quarter. If it lands heads, you call her. Deal? Ken nods, and Chuck flips it. It comes up heads, and Ken Ken nods, grabs the coin from Chuck, going to the phones. starts to put the coin in the slot, then realizes it is a headed coin. He smiles and throws the coin back to Chuck, then digs a quarter out of his pocket and dials.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Megan? It's me. Can we get together and talk? Ken looks over his shoulder at Chuck, who is still lookin him.

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah, all of us. I want to try. Kelly walks into the restaurant, carrying some packages. hands her a glass of wine and toasts. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: olden rev.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: To what?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: To true romance! They share a toast, with Ken in the b.g.  olden rev. 80 81 82

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moon is setting, and the sun is rising. The sky is bl red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken, Megan and Lauren are walking together. Ken and his w are talking, while Lauren is watching all the activity. Shots of: Ken and Lauren playing video games Ken and Megan watching Lauren play a game Eating some cotton candy Playing volleyball on the beach. Bumper cars. Shopping Trying on goofy hats, etc. As they are walking, Ken stops, remembering the pin. He g Lauren the pin he bought while with Chuck, putting it on sweater.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You seem different, Ken. Well, not different, more like the old Ken.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: I told you, I'm trying... They continue walking around the mall, and Ken and Megan hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the end of the day. Lauren is bouncing in the amusem area behind them, while Ken is walking with Megan. Megan a bench.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Can you sit for a little while, please?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: I'd like that. They sit down on the bench, side by side. They both want talk, but neither knows how to begin. Ken is playing with pin he gave Lauren, which is on the sweater she is wearin (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: olden rev. 10/17/97) Ken looks him. 60

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Megan...I know it's been tough, and I haven't been trying hard enough. I want to change that.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You know, it was never about not loving you. at her, surprised. He thought she had stopped loving

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: I don't know how to explain it. I...just shut off the world...

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You shut me out, and I can't, I refuse, to live like that.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: It was the biggest mistake I ever made. I won't do that again--I need your support, all the time.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: You have it. You always have.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: So, what do you say? Can we live together, a family.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I want to try.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Me too. How about moving back in this weekend? I'll try to free up from this case to help.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Sounds like a plan. Lauren would love to move back home...

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: How about you?

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, me too. Ken and Megan share a tender, beautiful kiss. Lauren runs up and is overjoyed by the sight of their kis (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: olden rev. 10/17/97) 83 61 Lauren smiles happily, content. In the middle of this kiss, Ken's beeper goes off.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Damn! He looks at the beeper, and clicks it off.

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: That's OK. Comes with the territory.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Don't forget! This weekend.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: This weekend. Be careful.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: You got it. He hands Lauren over to Megan, and they sit on the porch, watching him go. Megan kisses Lauren on the forehead, and smooths her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken, Chuck and Kelly show up at the crime scene. Ken and immediately take control of the situation, while Kelly ha back. The body is on the floor, covered with a sheet.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Another one, Detective. No weapons, no prints, no witnesses, nothing. While Chuck is talking to the Officer, Ken is looking aro the crime scene. Chuck lifts the sheet off the body, grimaces, then puts i back.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, there's something written on the floor. I couldn't make it out... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Thanks. We'll look around for a while. Chuck and Ken immediately look at the blood pooled around body. There do indeed seem to be letters scrawled on the ground, in the blood.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you read it?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: No. You?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: It looks like a "C" and an "A..." (to photographer ) Get some good shots of this, and blow them up for me, OK? The Photographer nods. Kelly is off at the back of the room, and she notices the picture frames knocked off the wall. She bends over and carefully, wearing gloves, places them back on the wall. prominent picture is missing, and there is blood on the w where it was.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: What do you make of this? There's blood on the wall. Now he's interested.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: The mystery picture. Who do you think is in it?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Get a shot of the wall, and as soon as the scene is processed, get these pictures over to the office too, OK? You did good, Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken, Chuck and Kelly are together in a large meeting star at the pictures of the crime scene. One of the pictures, blown up very big, is the letters wr in the blood. It's obvious that the letters are C-H-A. On bulletin board next to the pictures they are writing out the possible "Cha" words. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: olden rev.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: I tell you, he's trying to write the Killer's name. One list is possible last names (like Champlaign, etc.). have a phone book out opened to the CHA pages. Kelly reads the list of "ch" names:

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Chamberlain. Chambers. Chambless. Chameleon...

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: It doesn't ring right.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: He's not writing Champagne, that's for sure. Kelly pulls out a dog-eared dictionary, and leafs through pages.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Maybe he's spelling something else. Chamber, chamberlain, chambermaid...

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: The chambermaid did it...

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Chamber music, chambray, chameleon...chamfer, chaoisa, chamomile, champ, champagne, champion...

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Wait a minute!

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Champion! Son of a bitch!

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: It was right here the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: All the victims were or are champions. He's killing them all. He goes to the victims' photographs on the wall. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: olden rev. 10/17/97) 64

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Boxing. Wrestling. Tough Man. Karate. Kendo. Kickboxing. Shit! These are all champions--but they wouldn't have fought each other. They have their own competitions. Ken is silent for a moment, then raises his head to look directly at Chuck.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: They fought together once.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Yeah, and the link is her father, my instructor.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: You hear of the Master's Challenge?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Damn it!

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Remember the tag line?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: "The Tournament of Champions" They look at each other. They've made the connection, now they have to find the killer.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: I've got some magazines with those pictures in it. He pulls a magazine out of his drawer, and leafs through He finds the picture he was looking for.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here it is!

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: That's it. This is the photo from the Master's Challenge.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Recognize anyone? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Most of them are staring at steel, in drawers at the morgue. Think our boy is in this picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The picture from the Master's Challenge is blown up very and tacked up on the wall. Six of the Champions are alrea dead, and there are two left. Ken goes up to the blown up picture, with a red pen in hi hands. As he says the name of each victim, he puts a red across their faces.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Eddie Cunningham, boxer. Victim. Dutch Schultz, tough man. Victim. Kurt McKinney, point Karate. Mark Cramer, Kickboxing, victim. Master Tokaido, victim. Kevin Haley, Judo, victim. Ken circles two of the heads, men not accounted for.

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who are these guys? Chuck comes into the room, a file in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: The first guy is Chad Atkins, kung fu stylist, disqualified during the Tournament of Champions for excessive contact. Broke some poor guy's ribs.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: I like him so far.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Don't fall in love, it'd be a tough arrest. Computer says he died in a car accident three years ago.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Shit. Just then, Chief Hutchins comes into the room for an upda

dialogues.speaker: HUTCHINS
dialogues.text: So, what's the story?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Six murdered. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: olden rev. 10/17/97) 66

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of the remaining two in the picture, one is dead, car crash, confirmed.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: That leaves this guy, Willie Namath. He fits the profile--age, height and weight. Kelly, you recognize him?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: No. It happened too fast, and...I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: This Namath guy has a sheet you wouldn't believe. He's been picked up a bunch of times for assault, and even did time for assault with intent to kill.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: No model citizen.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: It gets worse. We had him here last month on something unrelated. Couldn't hold him...

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Fuck me...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: We won't let him go this time

dialogues.speaker: HUTCHINS
dialogues.text: He's our guy, right?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Everything points to him, Chief.

dialogues.speaker: HUTCHINS
dialogues.text: Let's get him. I'll set up the strike team.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: I don't know. Something isn't right... Nobody listens to her. Chuck and Ken grab their guns and getting ready to leave. Kelly goes out with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken and Chuck are hurrying down to the squad cars, Kelly pursuit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: olden rev. 10/17/97) 87

dialogues.speaker: 87A
dialogues.text: 67 They get to the car, ready to hop inside.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Do I get a gun? Ken turns around, shocked that she is even there.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Sorry, Kelly. You can't go along. You'll have to stay here until we find this guy.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You said yourself I was safer with you two.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Yeah, but we're walking into the valley of the shadow of death here. We won't be able to protect you.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: You know I can take care of myself.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Discussion's over, decision's been made. It's for your own good, Kell.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Right. That must be why I feel so good.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Let's go. Chuck and Ken leave, and Kelly stays behind, fuming. She not happy with the situation. She watches them leave. We STAY on Kelly, as she watches out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops are loading up into squad cars, their lights flashin Kelly, despondent, walks off in a completely other direct She does NOT go back into the police station like they as her to. We HOLD ON Kelly as she walks off.

dialogues.text: A U-Haul pulls up in front of Ken's house. Megan is drivi and she gets out, then goes to the passenger side. Lauren gets out, and they start to move their things back into K house. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: olden rev.

dialogues.text: Their house, again. She pulls out a cellular phone and di it, sending a page to Ken.

dialogues.text: Ken and Chuck are outside the house, backed by a SWAT tea the yard, and around the sides. Ken and Chuck nod at each other, and double time it to th front door. They get up on the porch, and pause for a mom  olden rev. 10/17/97) 89 90 91 68

dialogues.text: Chuck KICKS the door open, and comes through quickly, sca the room with his eyes and his gun. The GUY is sitting at a desk, and as soon as he sees Chuc SPRINTS for the stairs. Ken comes into the house, and together they chase the Guy the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

69 Ken and Chuck chase the Guy out onto the balcony and ATTA Ken and Chuck get hit, and a FIGHT starts. The Man is a pretty good fighter, but he is no match for and Chuck. They subdue him fairly quickly, just in time f the SWAT team to storm into the area, their weapons drawn They surround the Man, even though the Man is already han and defeated.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Thanks, guys. I think we can take it from here.

There are lots of people around her, dancing and partying Her mood is in stark contrast to the party going on aroun her. A distinctive BEEP sounds, 0.S., and Kelly looks up to se what it is. dialogues.text: It's a metal joint, in my hand... Kelly watches the person, and when he turns around Kelly the Killer, recognizes him! It's Chad Atkins from the picture! FLASHBACK to the picture. The man who the computer said was dead! His metal fingers are setting the metal detector off! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: olden rev. 93 94
70 As soon as Kelly sees the Killer, the Killer sees her. Th time, however, the Killer doesn't stop. He's going after Kelly. The Killer turns to where Kelly was sitting, and she is n longer there.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Who is hiding on the dance getting lost in the crowd. The Killer comes through the crowd, searching for her. Kelly moves through the crowd, looking behind her, anxiou The Killer, stalking her. The music abruptly stops, and the dance floor clears of d The Killer spots Kelly and moves towards her, grabbing he the shirt, lifting her up off the chair! It's not Kelly! He scans the crowd for Kelly, she's nowhere to be seen. H too exits the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Killer looks around the parking lot. No one is there. There are a couple of PARTY GOERS, laughing and happy. Kelly is not there. The Killer, knowing that he has to leave, goes to his car the parking lot. He starts his car and drives off the lot, pulling into tr AS soon as he leaves the parking lot, Kelly sits up in th driver's seat of her car. She starts her car and follows

dialogues.text: Shot of the Killer's car coming down the street, followin a safe distance by Kelly's car. (CONTINUED)

71 It is a very run down house in a run down neighborhood. N of the windows are broken, but the place matches the rest the houses on the street. The Killer drives home, and goes inside in a hurry. Kelly drives up and parks, watching and waiting. She star to get out of her car as soon as he is inside, but he com out of his house right away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police cars are loaded up and pulling off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly is out of her car, watching the house. The Killer suddenly comes back out, his clothes changed, gets into h car again and roars off. Kelly waits for a moment, watching the street all the whi then runs to get into the garage right before the garage goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly is making her way through the house, looking in var rooms. It is all very spooky, very frightening. The house well kept inside, but very old. She is exploring, looking for clues, evidence, anything. Kelly comes across a phenomenal computer set up, acupunct dummy, and a bulletin board filled with pictures of the killings, news clippings, lists upon lists of victims, an on.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Will the mystery guest please sign in? She picks up the phone next to the computers and dials a

dialogues.text: Ken and Chuck are riding in their car, returning to the s

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Seemed a little easy, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Way too easy. The guy barely fought back, and he wasn't much of a fighter... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: olden rev. 10/17/97)

dialogues.speaker: 71A
dialogues.text: Just then, Ken's receives a beeper message. He looks down the alphanumeric display. It reads: "Found real killer. 132 Lynn Ave. I'm inside, hurry. Kell (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Shit! Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken and Chuck's car does a 180 and roars off in the oppos direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kelly is still searching through the house. It's creepy, she has to keep looking. All the rooms so far have been deserted. She opens a door, and a figure comes out of the closet at She screams, only to see that the "figure" is a coat on a that fell from the closet. She breathes a sigh of relief and closes the closet. To come FACE TO FACE WITH THE KILLER!

dialogues.speaker: KILLER
dialogues.text: Well, Kelly. How nice to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: (frightened, stammering) Have we met?

dialogues.speaker: KILLER
dialogues.text: Don't be coy. I've done some research on your career. You were a national champion, right?

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: KILLER
dialogues.text: How interesting. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken and Chuck are in the car, careening through the stree trying to get to the Killer's house as soon as they can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLAM! Kelly goes flying back against the wall, hitting it with incredible force! The Killer, still smiling, advances on her.  olden rev. 101 102 103 104

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken is driving fast.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Hit it!

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Call for backup!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car careens around the corner, flying down the street

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken and Chuck pull up to the house. All is quiet. They ru up to the house, and kick the door in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They rush into the house, Chuck's gun drawn, flashlights piercing the gloomy inside.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Police! Kelly! No answer. They go into the house. In the first room, they find the computer set up. It's ev more impressive than what Justice had. Several computer monitors are on, complete with all kinds of supporting ha As they go into the room, Kelly's body falls out of a clo landing on the floor with a ThUD! (CONTINUED)
74 Chuck reaches Kelly, and touches her. She's cold!

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, no. Chuck puts a hand up to his mouth, trying to block out th image. Ken SNAPS his head up, seeing Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: No! Ken goes over to where Kelly is, and just as he gets ther hears the computer behind him.

dialogues.speaker: KILLER VOICE
dialogues.text: A lovely family you have, Ken. Ken WHIPS his head around to look at the computer. A new picture comes up, and it is of Ken, his wife and da obviously taken during their afternoon out. Then, the pic of Ken turns into the picture of the Killer, and he pulls a knife to kill the wife and daughter.

dialogues.speaker: KILLER VOICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Someone has to take care of your family, Ken. Ken runs to the computers and immediately snatches up the to call his wife, to warn her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone is ringing, and Megan comes out of the dining r where she was talking, to answer the phone. She is smilin she picks up the phone, very at ease.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Megan? Are you OK?  olden rev. 107 108 109 110 1414

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I'm fine. This is so like you, letting someone else do the dirty work.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: What are you talki

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: Your friend got here about an hour ago, told me you couldn't get away, and helped me move everything ng about? in...

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: What friend? <BEAT> Megan, listen to me. Where is he now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Megan, still holding the phone, leans back to look into t living room. The Killer is sitting with L She is smiling and talking happily, and the Killer seems fully concentrated on the yo Megan pulls back into the ki

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: He's sitting next getting along...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken cuts her off.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: If you can get awa don't let on anything's wrong, and I'll be there right awa hurt you, Megan. you.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: I'm scared, Ken. auren, ung girl. tchen. to Lauren.

dialogues.speaker: OUS
dialogues.text: y, do it. y. I won't I promise. his arm around her. They're If not, let him I love 75 107 108 109 110 1414  olden rev. 10/17/97) 76

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: I know, baby. I'll be right there.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: (in phone) Don't hang up, let me call Lauren. She turns to look back into the living room, and comes fa face with the Killer, who is standing with his arm around Lauren.

dialogues.speaker: KILLER
dialogues.text: Is that my good buddy, Ken? Let me talk to him... He takes the phone away from her, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: KILLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come for me, Ken. I'm waiting in the Forge. By the way, it's just us now, no one else. Just you, or they're dead. The Killer hangs up. Ken stands there for a moment, looking at the phone. Chuc standing next to him, has heard the entire conversation. Ken grabs the computer and is about to SMASH it down on t floor when Chuck stops him.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Ken, that's evidence.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: There's not going to be a trial. Ken SLAMS the computer down onto the hard floor, and it S into a million pieces. Ken starts out of the house. Chuck starts to follow him, Ken whips around and stops him.

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's just me and him now.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Bullshit. We're a team, man. I'm going with you.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: No, you're not. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: olden rev. 10/17/97)

dialogues.speaker: 76A
dialogues.text: Ken starts for the door, and Chuck grabs his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: We're cops, man. We don't do this! Ken grabs Chuck, and Chuck grabs him. They come together, face to face.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: This is my family here! I can't take the chance... He PUSHES Chuck back, and he stumbles and ends up on the Ken heads for the front door. When Ken gets to the front door, Chuck calls out...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Ken! Ken turns around, ready for a battle. Chuck pulls his gun of his holster. Then turns it around and throws it to Ken.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kick his ass! Ken acknowledges Chuck as he catches the gun, then runs o the door.  olden rev. 113 114 115 116

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ken is in the car, rushing to the Forge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 77 Ken's car comes FLYING up the road to the Forge, dust plu behind it. Looming in front of them is an abandoned warehouse/factory complex. The only other car there is Me Ken hops out of the car, checks Megan's car, then they bo run up to the entrance of the Forge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go in. (CONTINUED)

78 Ken walks into the forge, and there, with his back turned the Killer. Waiting for him. Ken moves forward, carefully but still quite fast. Ken has Chuck's gun drawn, and he is ready to shoot. He advances on the Killer, who still has his back turned.

dialogues.speaker: KILLER
dialogues.text: Greetings! You wouldn't shoot me in the back, would you?

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Shit!

dialogues.speaker: KILLER
dialogues.text: Especially when I am the only one who knows where Ken's lovely wife and daughter are. They HOLD in this position for a BEAT, and Ken, the frust evident in his face, FIRES the gun, emptying it.

dialogues.speaker: THE KILLER
dialogues.text: The shots all landed, right next to the Killer's head. He turns around, a HUGE smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: KILLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Welcome to hell.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: KILLER
dialogues.text: I don't want them, I want you.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: They aren't champions, they are innocent.

dialogues.speaker: KILLER
dialogues.text: They are part of the plan, Ken. Just like you and me.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Your grand plan?!? (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: olden rev. 10/17/97)

dialogues.speaker: KEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Man, we figured you out long ago--you couldn't hack it as a fighter, so you started killing the real champions. The psychologist said something about penis envy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KILLER
dialogues.text: Banter all you want, the end game has begun. He whirls and takes off. Ken gives chase, and they fight a brief moment, then the Killer disappears. Ken looks around, moving through the forge. The Killer appears again, and they fight some more. The Killer is leading him somewhere. The Killer then disappears again. Vanished.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: He is looking through the factory complex. He passes thro cavernous rooms, and small office areas, the glass in the windows and lights long since smashed. He doesn't see anything or anyone out of the ordinary. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: olden rev.

81 Ken continues searching, and he comes to a decrepit secti the Forge, and across the floor Ken sees... The Killer standing with his back to Ken. Megan and Lauren are tied up in the b.g., in a showplace position behind the Killer. A BUNDLE is strapped to the wall behind them. Ken moves back into the shadows of the walls, hoping that Killer doesn't see him. There is no indication that he ha seen him, but then the Killer says.

dialogues.speaker: KILLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come closer, Detective O'Hara. Ken advances on the Killer. The Killer has a timer in his hands, and he holds it up.

dialogues.speaker: KILLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Far enough. I have placed a crude bomb next to your wife and daughter. We have 15 Minutes for the Grand Championship match. Life or death, it's in your hands. The Killer presses the button on the timer, the red LED n begin to count down.

dialogues.speaker: KILLER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There's no going back now. Shall we begin?

dialogues.speaker: LAUREN AND MEGAN
dialogues.text: They are struggling with their bonds, but it's no use. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: olden rev.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: He sees the situation, and knows that he has to fight. The Killer settles into a fighting stance.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: They are nothing to you.

dialogues.speaker: KILLER
dialogues.text: Exactly, but they are everything to you. Now you have the motivation to fight me with everything you have. You are like the samurai, ready to die.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: I hope you're ready to die, motherfucker. Ken walks up close to him, and assumes a fighting positio They fight! The Killer KIAIS loudly and attacks. As the fight goes on, it becomes clear that Ken is overma and he is going to lose. Ken is a superb fighter, but so the Killer. The Killer gets hit a little bit, but he is d more damage to Ken that he is taking. It's going to take a little time, but Ken is going to los And that means he is going to die, and so are his wife an daughter.

dialogues.speaker: KILLER
dialogues.text: I still haven't met my match.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: You're going to meet your maker.

dialogues.speaker: KILLER
dialogues.text: Not today. They continue to fight, and it is spectacular. But, Ken is losing. Only by a little bit, but the Killer just a little faster, a little better. He is no match for Killer, who is a phenomenal fighter. The Killer senses that he has the advantage, and starts t take the fight to Ken. Soon, Ken is in real trouble, and Killer is setting him up for the kill. Angle on Timer: it's getting close. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: olden rev.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN AND LAUREN
dialogues.text: They are terrified.

dialogues.speaker: KEN AND KILLER
dialogues.text: Ken is helpless, and the Killer reaches back, preparing t killing strike, a smile on his face. The Killer strikes the killing blow, and... Chuck comes out of nowhere and KICKS, blocking the strike The Killer still hits Chuck in the leg, and he collapses the ground.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Go after them! The Killer, enraged, attacks Chuck, hitting him at will. Ken, meanwhile, heads for Lauren and Megan. The Killer spots Ken running for his family, and leaves C cutting Ken off.

dialogues.speaker: KILLER
dialogues.text: You couldn't save Kelly, your partner, your family...And you can't save yourself... They fight each other, and the heavens open. Lighting flashes and the Gods watch, the fate of the worl the balance. Ken, unbelievably, is getting the upper hand. He is takin great deal of punishment, but it's with a purpose. He is taking a shot to give a better shot, and for the fi time in his killing spree, the Killer is hurt. Soon, Ken is taking less punishment, and meting out more.

dialogues.speaker: TIMER
dialogues.text: The Killer starts looking for somewhere to escape, to get from this fighting machine that doesn't care about pain, injury.

dialogues.speaker: KEN
dialogues.text: Nowhere to run, asshole. He SLAMS the Killer over and over, finally finishing him with a series of beautiful techniques. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: olden rev.

dialogues.speaker: TIMER
dialogues.text: Ken steps over the Killer on his way to save Megan and La when the Killer REARS up and grabs Ken's leg, trying to s him. Ken turns back to him and puts him away, for good this ti (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: olden rev.
84 He turns and runs to where Megan and Lauren are.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN
dialogues.text: No! There's no time! Ken keeps coming.

dialogues.speaker: MEGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stop! Back up! NO! She knows the bomb is going to go off, and she wants to s Ken.

dialogues.speaker: TIMER
dialogues.text: Ken will have none of it. He runs to them, loosening the and grabbing them, trying to shield them from the force o bomb!

dialogues.speaker: TIMER
dialogues.text: The bomb EXPLODES! Ken THROWS Megan and Lauren to the ground, protecting the from the blast. But the blast is not what they expected. It's no bomb at all--it's a firework, that has thrown mil of pieces of silver confetti into the air. It's beautiful, and it's harmless. They are alive, and they are unhurt. Ken goes to them, throwing his arms around them. Chuck appears in the midst of the silver shower, smiling holding up his hands. He is hurt, but still alive.

dialogues.speaker: KILLER VOICE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: No slaughter of the innocents, O'Hara. The Killer's voice is a small, digital recorder, linked t package. The CAMERA pulls back, revealing the entire Forge, Chuck the Killer in the foreground, Ken and his family.
